p: The tools and approaches presented in this special issue are a mix of the tried-and-tested and those under active development and exploration. The age of an approach should not impact its use, provided the approach remains useful. ‘Fashions’ in infectious disease modelling will rise, only to be replaced by the latest trends, but with time it is possible to see approaches that continue to provide insight, even if the specifics have been updated using modern tools. In this section we offer some thoughts about how methods might develop.
